text:
Indian equity benchmarks declined after their longest streak of gains in at least two months as investors awaited the release of quarterly data on the nation’s economic growth.The S&P BSE Sensex Index fell as much as 0.32 percent to 33,572.32, while the NSE Nifty 50 Index also fell as much as 0.40 percent to 10,348.The market breadth was tilted in favour of buyers. Thirteen of the 19 sector gauges compiled by the BSE Ltd. fell led by the S&P BSE Teck Index falling 0.48 percent. On the flipside, the S&P BSE Consumer Durables Index rose 0.58 percent, making it the best performer.






Here Are The Stocks Moving The Market This Morning:
title: Stocks Radar: Ashok Leyland, ONGC, Rain Industries
